reviews.review:
Don't go to this place
Not even one item is edible
Very bad service
Except water nothing tasted good
Waste of money

The only Indian restaurant on the strip and it couldn't live up to the expectation. Never had such a bland Indian food in my life! The service was horrible too. No one attended us or gave us a water refill. Expect better from a Punjabi Indian restaurant. Too disappointed .

One of the places where you can get Jain food. The waiter even wrote Jain in front of the items (so I suppose they might be getting a lot of Jain customers)

We ordered the following Jain items this time.
Malai Paneer
Yellow Daal
Mutter Paneer

The last time (around 2 years ago) they also made Jain Malai Kofta (during dinner)

I have been to this place around 4 times and its always a saviour :)

This time around they were very busy so the service sucked (its not like this always), but yes sometimes we take the buffet, so not much service is required anyways. We could see several people waiting to be seated and they were also getting a little bit frustrated.

Would definitely recommend this place for good Jain food.
The food and ambience are very good. It's been a long while my wife and I had good Indian cuisine something which we miss in Torrance CA.

Seriously loved this place! The owner is so nice and kind and so was our waiter! Although we were about 1 hour late for our reservation they still held a table for us! The food was amazing. I really recommend eating here. The butter chicken and lamb biryani is too die for.

For an 8pm reservation on a Saturday night, I didn't have a problem getting in.

When we got to the restaurant, it was relatively empty.

When we left, there were many more people.

The website is kinda deceiving.  They show the nice lounge area (which is NOT where they seat you for dinner).  The lounge area was nice, but it wasn't open at all when I was there. (and I left at 10pm)

The food was pretty good.  I couldn't believe that the entrees didn't come with Naan or anything.  Everything (Dal, Naan, etc.) had to be ordered a la carte (for an extra charge).  We ordered the Naan and Roti which only came with four pieces each. 

Maybe I'm just used to going to places where the Naan is free and you get it by the basket-load.

I would definitely go back again if I wanted Indian food while in Vegas.

The service was excellent too.  Very attentive and quick.

Best tandoori chicken in the galaxy. No exaggeration. Moist and tender but full of flavor. The buffet was full of great choices and they all seem freshly prepared. Everything tasted great. Great ambience and decor inside. Cool retro concept. The place is a bit hidden in the strip but what a great place to enjoy an Indian buffet. Service was great. Will definitely be back on my next visit to Vegas.
easily my fave Indian in the Valley. Great location w/surprisingly convenient parking (for the Strip). Best buffet of its kind in town. Very nicely remodeled dining area & restrooms a few yrs back.
Looking for Indian food on the strip, this place is easy to locate. Food is okay. Good ambience.

This place is legit!! Hidden in a strip mall and filled with Indian clientele!

Went in for buffet night and was so happy! got to try everything from goat curry (delicious and tender) to chicken Marsala! Well worth it!  The buffet was big with many choices for everyone!  

Bar service needs a little help but hey, i should have just ordered beer and not a vodka tonic!

Will be back!!

Waited 10 mins but none of the servers acknowledged us. Had to ask a server to be seated. The food was ok at best. Half the dishes were mislabeled. No one came by to ask us for drinks. Waited 10 mins for the check. There again had to get up and ask for it. Same for the card to be taken and charged. 

I've been to Tamba 5 times now and food and service quality has gotten worse every time. Never coming here again.
Don't bother ordering off the menu the service is poor. The  good reviews are prolly for the buffet. Al a carte is a disaster here.

I absolutely LOVE Indian food but I don't just love any place I go to. THIS place is fantastic! The food was being served buffet style so I got to sample a good array of items. I have to say, the items were in Indian so I had no idea about a few items that I was eating but since I'm adventurous like that, I put a teeny bit of whatever I didn't know and then decided if I wanted seconds. Certain items were a tad spicy but not enough to ruin your meal if you're sensitive to heat. The Tandoori Chicken, which always tends to be dry, was super juicy, the Curry Chicken was fragrant and addicting. The Rice was soft and fluffy and they give u a basket of Naan for your table. I may have been the only Spanish person here, lol, everyone else was Indian, I love that, very telling AND promising. The price is right, $14 for a very clean, well maintained, hot meal. If you want a hearty, savory meal this would be the place to go. Vegas wants to attack your pocket and serve u junk, but this place is the real deal. I would DEFINITELY go back.
Loved the food and the service so much that we ate here twice during our brief stay in Vegas. It's a bit pricey, so be sure to look through your resort magazine for the 10% off coupon.
excellent vegetarian food,  an oasis for Indian food in Vegas.  Try paneer butter masala and malai kofta., the daal tadka is delicious too!

mediocre indian food buffet.  Not bad, but not super impressive.
vegetarian options.
After so long found one Indian resturant with actual touch of indian food. North Indian food was awesome. Good ambience, nice people and awesome food. Love this place!

I am an Indian, and I love Indian food, which is why I was quite excited to try this restaurant, after reading all the positive reviews. We went there for their Sunday buffet, which is supposed to be the best. I was fairly disappointed with the food, as it was quite bland and flavorless. The north-Indian food was extremely ordinary. The south-Indian Idlis were good, but there was no coconut chutney to go with it. Also, my wife and I were feeling quite weird after eating the food. I would definitely skip this place...

Chicken vandaaloo and chicken qorma both were good. naan was soft and yummy. chicken vindaalo was not too spicy for 10 mo old which is great. 4 year old ate whole naan. pretty good but on expensive side. two entree, naans and samosa came up to be $65.

Worst buffet ever. Almost like stale food. The only good thing was the aloo tikki. This place actually is the only one closest to the strip hence takes the liberty to serve food cold and stale. Don't go.
Low key spot with good food and ambience away from the fake hotel fare.
Bad service food. Was cold order a la carte and bring the food from buffet counter. We ask for manager told us he is not there today

This restaurant was a great find! We love Indian cuisine and Tamba did not disappoint. The food was very good with subtle and distinctive flavor. The service was gracious and accommodating. And the quiet atmosphere was a great break from the hectic Strip. Value is excellent.
My friend and I went with the "feast" options on the menu, which turned out to be just the right amount of food. Everything was delicious (especially the Rogan Josh), and service was fast and polite.

Boyfriend and I were in Las Vegas for a small getaway. Staying a little off the Strip was nice, however, getting food is always a pain in the ass due to constant tourist everywhere. We decided we should try somewhere close that, preferably. wouldn't have very many tourists. Bring in Tamba. 

We made a reservation thinking the place would be jam packed, however, it was not. We were seated immediately, not having to wait at all because the place wasn't crowded at all. 

Their Chicken Tikka Masala was amazingly good. This is one of my favorite dishes, so I enjoy when I go to an Indian place that really makes it the way I like it. Their Naan was also delicious. We got the garlic naan, as well as the Alu Naan, which was also VERY good. 

I'd definitely go here again if I am in the area. It is somewhat off the beaten path. I don't think the tourist have really found this gem of a restaurant.

I liked the modern Indian atmosphere  The ambiance and light were perfect for a nice date with my wife.

We had the a meat sample platter which was amazing. Normally I don't go out of my way to eat fish, however the fish in the meat sample platter was cooked perfectly with a light crust and a lot of flavor without a "fishy" taste. The lamb was very tender and didn't have excessive fat either. We had the Garlic Naan, Tikka Masala with chicken, curry with Lamb, and a spinach curry with rice and Mango Lassi drinks. All of the meat was very tender and the spices were perfect. We also ended up getting the mango and pistachio ice cream which I was pleasantly surprised at how creamy it was.

Our server was very kind and he seemed like he was happy to serve us. He always kept our waters full at all times without being overbearing. 

Overall, it was a great experience at a classy Indian restaurant with a polite server and exceptional food! I would definitely recommend trying it on your next visit to the Strip!

An Indian restaurant with some good and some mediocre dishes. We went there for the lunch buffet on a weekday. There was a decent selection of food in a nicely decorated space. There were lots of "ethnic" types which is always a good sign.
The chicken curry, tandoori chicken and spiced cauliflower and potatoes were excellent. The naan was good and the dhaal and sambhar were actually not good. So there you have it.
Also there was no drink included with the meal for $12.99 which if fine. But what I found quite annoying was that you had to prepay and then if you wanted anything other than water, pay again. This did not make me happy.

Exc -Curry, Tandoori Chicken, spiced veggies.
Good - Decor
Ave - Food
Poor - Paying policy 

WOULD I GO BACK? Probably not. I think I would try another Indian restaurant first.

Wonderful food.  It was buffet night because so many people booked - they could only serve that many people buffet style. No worries everything tasted amazing.  Try the mango lassi- 
Staff was so friendly too.
It is hidden in the back of the food court at the Polo Towers on the second floor don't miss this place if you love Indian fare.

We went to have a dinner buffet during the thanks giving weekend.....They had Stale Biryani in the buffet.....when we informed the staff about it......they just removed the stale biryani from the buffet....but got the same biryani after 10 mins from kitchen and placed in buffet........that's the quality of food they serve!!!!!!!!!

Avoid Tamba

I disagree with any bad comments on this place! Maybe the buffet isn't the greatest but in general buffets are never that good. All the food just sits around. 

On that note, Me and my boyfriend went and ate here about a week ago bc a friend I had in my summer class at UNLV worked here.  Although he wasn't there that night we went anyways and everyone was so nice.  The service was excellent and the food was fantastic.  I completely disagree with the yelp from Sang whatever bc we ordered the Chicken tikka masala and it was awesome.  We also got the lamb vindaloo and the combo together was phenomenal.  The chicken tikka was so buttery and had a great flavor while the lamb vindaloo had the perfect amount of heat.  We had samosas of course and they were pretty good.  From my memory I've had better but everything else was delicious.  Our water was never empty and everyone was so nice.  We also had some dessert, a round cake like ball thing (dont know what its called) and some carrots.  Very good as well.  

The location is a little strange (I thought it was closed when we were going there) but they were open.  The atmosphere was great, the service was great, and the food was awesome.  The rest of the night me and my boyfriend kept saying how nice of a dinner that was and have been craving Indian food ever since! A+

Pretty good curries and naans. We went here not expecting much but came out impressed. 

We had the veg thali and loved the malai kofta and the raita. The gulab jamuns are also nice here. 

We will surely be visiting this place again. The food seemed freshly prepared. Do try the ginger fresh lime soda. It's pretty close to an indian soda shikanji. 

The best thing is that the saunf (fennel seeds) are not roasted. I usually avoid them at all the indian restaurants as they roast them and/or coat them with stuff. But here, they are just right. They are the thick ones though. Haven't seen the thin ones in any indian restaurant yet.
Very conveniently located and authentic, but the food was just okay. Not bad if you're craving Indian food while on Las Vegas strip.

Good lunch buffet. We tried veg biriyani & it was excellent. It's right on strip.
I would recommend to anyone looking for veg Indian food
Awful quality with awful staff. 9 of us had stomach upset after having lunch buffet.
Limited decent buffet menu, but the taste is good, esp., when compared to other north indian food located of the strip

I'll start things off by saying the food was good. They had dinner buffet instead of ala carte. The dal, khichdi and custard were really good. However, at $19 per person it was expensive. I'd recommend this place to others but not in the evening. They have tours stop here from the looks of it and they had parties of 30 people come in which lead to lines at the buffet.

This is a must visit for Indian good if you are in Vegas!
Buffet is out of the world -- amazing South Indian and North Indian variety and staff is absolutely great!! The flavors in each dish were so unique and differentiated .. Because of well made food!! You could make out each dish separately .. Thank you Tamba for great food and keep it up!

Even though it is a little hard to find upstairs in the hawaiian marketplace...this place is totally amazing once you get there! We go to Vegas about twice a year and we always make a point of going to Tamba's lunch buffet during our trip. If you like Indian food this place is amazing, the food is fresh and delicious, the ambiance inside is super nice and the service is great! Not to mention the price is so good for all the wonderful food they offer!

The food was fantastic.  My biggest disappointment was the bar.  We wanted martinis.  bartender said they were out of martini glasses.  One drink was so bad, we had to send it back.  If the drinks were as good as the food, I would give it 5 stars.  The host and waiter were super nice and friendly.  But I'm sure it's also bc they were checking us out the whole time we were there.
Good food at really nice price ($15 per head) Specially fruit custard and carrot dessert. Also the veg pakora

A hidden oasis! All I wanted after walking endlessly up and down the Strip was to find a reasonably priced restaurant that was quiet. This was it! Strangely placed on the second level of a nearly empty strip mall along the Strip, you might not know it was there. Beautiful inside with soft Indian music playing, this was a place I could forget that I was in Las Vegas and enjoy delicious curry. I shared the goat curry with my husband since the serving size easily serves 2 reasonable appetites along with rice and naan. The naan bread was delicious! The curry had a nice light spice and was probably a bit too salty, but I still loved it. The lime ginger soda was unexpectedly tasty too. I could see going back here a few more times if I were stuck here longer. The waitstaff was attentive too, though there weren't many diners. 

Okay, this isn't a place I would typically give 5 stars, but it was just what I needed at the time. One request - draft beer would be a good addition to the menu.

I never thought I'd say the highlight of my trip to Las Vegas would be finding Tamba Indian restaurant, but now I am.  I'm so glad we found this charming gem hidden upstairs in the back of a nondescript marketplace.  Kumar, our server, helped make our dinner so perfect.  He was friendly and professional, guiding us with selections from the menu by suggesting his personal favorites.  We started with samosa chaat appetizer and kabuli naan.  We shared a main of prawns in a flavorful red pepper curry with basmati rice.  Each dish was spot-on with a balance of flavor and spice.  We found the prices to be reasonable, especially by Vegas standards.  If you're looking for flavorful Indian cuisine away from the crowds, Tamba is the place.

The mango lassi was extremely unappetizing and not at all delicious.  There was no natural sweetness to it and it was super watery.

For appetizer,  we split the tandoori chicken.  Hugely disappointing.  Absolutely no flavor, not even on the outside. 

The goat biriyani is quite spicy, even if you ask to decrease the spice to a mild level. Our waiter said it ia because the spice is added to the meat itself and that decreasing the spice is hard. 

The rhogan josh was DELICIOUS. I literally tried to lick the entire dish. 

The chicken tikka masala was subpar, not what you would expect because it was sort of bland and did not have well cut pieces.  

For the best bang for your buck,  order ashoka's plate. You get a lot of variety and option to try many things. The gulab jamun on it was delicious and a great way to end the meal. The dal on it though had a very monotonous flavor.

fantastic buffet at $20 per head.
Amazing selection, very good naan. The food is not over-rich, oily and creamy. Is fresh and each dish has its own taste. Spices are just right.
Honestly this place was a lifesaver! I had had enough of Las Vegas with its cheesy, decadent food options... everything with mayo on it or some creamy goop. Or loads of carbs everywhere. And then at Tamba's buffet I got really really good food; hugely filling. The dessert - gulab jamun which many people get wrong (too dense or in thick stale sugar syrup) was perfect as well.
Although the 'katories' or styrofoam bowls I took the curries in were flimsy, they helped me taste everything separately and not have everything mixed in my plate. I liked that.
The entry to this place made us doubt it but then we saw it was full of people having good good food. I liked the no-fuss atmosphere of the place too. It was a place you could just chill at, relax and eat. Well done guys!

Mediocre. We paid 18 bucks per person for a dinner buffet that was acceptable for a 7.99 lunch. Staff was fine.  Taste and quality very underwhelming.  I usually eat so much at an Indian buffet that I am near exploding, but not this time.  I tried it all.
Tried the lunch buffet. It was pretty good and had a decent number of dishes. Dessert could have been better. The ambience is amazing and service is great too!
Yes, very very good. I'd recommend the lunch buffet for value for money. Same as the evening grub, for 2/3 of the price. Great service and vibe!
We had a dinner buffet. It was really good, being a Indian I am always comparing to real Indian meal I liked it to my taste. I would recommend it to everyone.

a must place to visit if u love indian food....there goat curry was amazing my husband loved it and as i m vegetarian i liked all their option available in their lunch buffet... definitely worth for every price we paid....the only difficulties which we found was finding this place...

I visited this place after 10 years. Hoping to find the same delicious food and seevice from ten years ago. Food was just OK. its not restaurant quality you would pay for. How could a "mild" requested Navratna Korma turn up spicey. This dish is made sweet all throught Mumbai. Not here. Not even upon special request.

Service by a certain server named Anand (tall guy, grey hair) was much below par. The only the only thing he did promptly was to take the initial order. For every thing else (water, soda, extra naan) we had to raise our hand in hope that this server would notice and come to the table.


We even had to wait long to get the check and the receipt. All this on a Tuesday night - not weekend.

When I tipped him apt to the service reveived (it was not zero. There was still some tip). This server totally lost his cool and started shouting abusive language in front of my kids. 

Not coming back here. Not even in a decade. Would prefer McDonald's to this place.

Advice for the Anand (the server). You are in the wrong profession. Hospitality is not about expcting good returns for bad service. It is certainly not about shouting bad language to your customer for the tip you receive.

3.5 rounded up to 4...

My friend and I were really lucky to find this restaurant, since it was hidden in a deserted mall/plaza. But to the point - it was delicious!

We decided to share "Ashoka's feast", which consisted of a variety of dishes because it was a good deal (comes with rice, naan, dessert, multiple meat dishes, etc.)... it was almost true, but the portions were a tad too small for two people. We had to order extra naan in the end and used it to dip the leftovers with. Everything was pretty good, but I just wish the food was bit more spicier. 

The servers were really friendly and helpful, too! I think this place really is the only Indian restaurant on the strip? Well, that's what they claim on their website...
Overall, not bad... Price comes out to around ~$15/person... Personally, I think I've had better, but I guess I'm not too picky about my Indian food because they always taste so flavorful to me. I think if I were to come back here, I'd come for the lunch buffet, though.

Food and service were excellent.  I went with a group of 16 people and everyone's order was correct, prompt and served at the same time.  Drinks were refilled immediately.  The food was flavorful and as described on the menu.  I would give it 5 stars, with the exception that I didn't have to pay the bill, so I can't really comment on the costs and /or the value aspect of this place.
Good food on a busy strip!! Liked the ambience and the quick service. I'm a vegetarian so malai kofta was pretty good. Chicken Tikka for my friend apparently came out really good (in his words)

This is a mandatory stop for us when we are in town. My husband and I enjoy the atmosphere and most importantly every dish we've tried. We live in SD and we haven't found any Indian food that we enjoy as much as we do here at Tamba. 

Our favorite dishes here are the Chicken Korma, Chicken Masala, Spinach Pakora, Samosa Chaat, & Aloo Gobi. Oh...and the garlic naan!

For dessert we always order the Gulab Jamun and Gajar Halwa.

I highly recommend this restaurant'

I recently went from mild vegetarian to full on vegan. I cook a lot at home because its not easy finding restaurants to eat at, especially in Las Vegas, the steakhouse capital of the world. I decided I needed to get out for Valentine's Day and chose to go Indian. I came across Tamba's amazing website and easily made up my mind. After making the reservation I read a few revues on Google and they worried me a bit, but I wasn't going to be shaken. I'm so glad I stayed with it, I loved this place. Staff was very friendly and the food was delicious! We tried the Bhel Puri for an appetizer, based off of the waiters recommendation, great choice. Then for entrees we went with the Aloo Gobi & Chana Masala. Both were amazing and complimented each other nicely, great for sharing. She went with a glass of house Chard, which turned out to be Mondavi(Nice!) and I tried one of the many Indian Imported beers. Hayward 5000 was the beer I went with and was perfect. Gotta find that at Lee's Discount Liquor, hope they have it. 

One side note, when they ask you for bread, it's not included. That was awkward. Also, parking is a bit rough.

Over all this was probably one of the least expensive Vday dinners I've ever had and also one of the most satisfying.

Man this place is great.  It is hidden in the back of the Hawaiian marketplace, so you need to seach for it, but wow!

The first good sign was when we walked in there and saw four Indian gentlemen with the Indian-style turbans (sorry for not being cultured enough to know what they are called) leaving...always a good sign for an ethnic restaurant.  But the food is excellent, and the value for being right on the strip is amazing.  Their chicken masala is to die for, but everything else we had was also excellent, including the saag.  The lunch buffet is a must try.  My wife and I both like Indian food, and this was some of the best, if not the best, we ever had.  Two days in Vegas- two trips to Tamba.
Really delicious food. Had the dinner buffet that had everything, got some chicken tikka masala and goat curry. My wife got the rice and sambar and some cheese paneer.

We had a fantastic experience at Tamba. We came for dinner and loved how the bustle from the street was completely gone once we stepped inside. Quiet and cozy ambiance, extremely friendly staff, fast service and very good food. We were impressed and will definitely come back!

Being one of the only Indian restaurants on the Las Vegas strip, you would think that they would really take advantage of the situation and show the world how great Indian food can be.  Instead, this restaurant is located inside a mostly vacant building, and the food they serve is very bland.

The good:
- great selection of vegetarian dishes
- the Sambar was the best item on the buffet
- atmosphere in the restaurant was good

The bad:
- Food was very bland, except for a couple of items that were good
- there were only 3 meat dishes and they were all chicken
- service was ok, no one ever came by to take my drink order
- fairly expensive for a lunch buffet ( $15 a person without a drink)

This place was okay, but there are better places to go for dinner than here.  But if you are craving indian food, then this is basically the only choice you have along the strip.

The only downside of Tamba is trying to locate it in the back of the run-down Hawaiian Marketplace. The food is outstanding. The buffet lunch is great at $13.00 per person and features a very good malai paneer. The staff is friendly and attentive. As an added bonus, the interior is very classy.

Came here for a Sunday afternoon lunch.Food was decent but we barely had any options.  Slow service. They took 10 min to replenish naan and I waited 20 min to get my mango lassi drink. Buffet was 15$.
Awesome food! We ordered Ashoka thali. Best Tandoori chicken I have tasted. It melts in your mouth! Nice service!. Going back again!

We were looking for an Indian Restaurant in Las Vegas and found this one on Yelp. 
We went there a 8 pm. Many guests were Indians. So... I think this is a good sign. The Service was absolutely friendly. And we had a very tasty Dinner in a great atmosphere. Las Vegas and all the Bling Bling seems to be far far away. Very nice!

Pathetic service, pathetic spread of dinner buffet, pathetic ambiance.

The servers did not know the scotches available on and off the menu. The dinners quality and taste does not justify the cost of the buffet. 

If you have nowhere else to go, got unnecessary money to spend on tasteless food, then also think twice before going to tamba.
Worst Indian food I have ever eaten and definetly not worth the $13.95 for buffet! Mint was asked better then this!

Very mediocre Indian food.  Naans were cold. Currys that these guys serve are cheapest and most commonly available in all Indian restaurants. For this you will be paying ridiculously high price. 

Please improve your food and menu.

I had lunch buffet with my family. The food here is real good and everyone of us liked it. It has a great ambience and is really good for large groups too. Also since it's located on the strip, it's a nice place to have lunch after walking down the strip for few miles. I also took the advantage of Yelp checkin, which got me 10% off on my bill.

Am Strip gelegen aber etwas versteckt im Hawaii Market Place. Wir haben bei unserem Las Vegas Besuch einmal beim Mittagsmenü zu uns genommen.


 Das sehr große Restaurant war gut besucht und es waren auch sehr viele indische Gäste im Raum. Dies haben wir als gutes Zeichen gedeutet und haben das Mittagsmenü für ca. 12 Euro zu uns genommen.


 Man kann america like sich soviel Speisen wie gewünscht an einem Buffett holen. Die Auswahl war ok, man findet von allem etwas und man kann sich auch ohne den Reis satt essen. In den deutschen Retaurants wird man ja meist so satt weil einem Berge an Reis angeboten werden.


 Zu dem Essen wird einem kostenlos Wasser ausgeschenkt und auch häufig nachgefüllt, ok wir haben das Wasser in Plasikbecher erhalten aber immerhin umsonst :-)


 Allgemein ist es eine schöne Abwechslung in Vegas auch zu einem Inder zu gehen

This review is for the lunch buffet. Food on the buffet was good, not great. Too many vegetarian dishes. Naan was on the buffet, I prefer fresh naan brought to the table.

Atmosphere was depressing. Tamba is in an indoor "mall", with ZERO other businesses. 

You pay before you eat which is fine if you have cash for tip. Several reviews said non alcoholic drinks are included, that wasn't the case on Sunday when we visited. We weren't asked if we wanted drinks until we were seated, since we already paid, we decided to stick with water. Lost revenue on their part.

Overall, it was ok. My husband and I prefer Namaste and Mt. Everest. 

As Vegas locals, we will probably not return to Tamba as the only draw is that we live across the street from it.
The worst Indian food ever. Sucks in quality, service and hygiene. Don't waste your money, goto Mint India Bistro instead.

Five star Indian lunch buffet. I've been here a few times but only for the lunch buffet. 

The restaurant is the antithesis of the Strip. It is at the back of a Hawaiian-themed, courtyard mall with other restaurants, t-shirt stores, Half Priced Tickets, street performers, etc. 

You enter an office building, take an escalator up a flight, and the restaurant is maybe 25 feet away.  Subdued lighting, calming music, wonderful smells. A little oasis in the midst of the Strip. 

Food is very good for a buffet. A little spicy as it should be. Very friendly waitstaff. 

Price at $15 is reasonable for Vegas and even better if you get the 10% off from Yelp for checking in.

My first time here. The Sunday Buffet dinner was just amazing. The Idlis were so soft, they just melted in my mouth.
You MUST try this south Indian dish to believe it. One of the best Idlis I have eaten outside India.

I had to take a STAR off because they employ kids to serve water and plates.Somehow dint like the idea of that.

The food for the most part was fantastic. While this restaurant is on the expensive side, the quality of the food is outstanding. The lamb kabobs are extremely tender and flavorful, and the naan is as good as it can possibly get. The only thing to stay away from  is the saag paneer. It's not bad, but it's not the best either. The restaurant is very nicely decorated and provides a nice setting for dining.
Veggie biryani was fantastic, paranthas were hot . Though i had asked for mild it did appear to be a little hot but was delicious. The cucumber Raitha did not have cucumbers at all.

This place has a buffet for dinner most of the time I think.

It's really sub-par indian food, although it wasn't bad, just completely unexceptional.

Service was fine.
Wait times are awful and the service is horrendous. Food was mediocre at best.
The food here was excellent, a little on the spicy side, but probably the best Indian food on the strip. The yellow dal was very good.
Nice restaurant and ambience is very good. It is primarily North Indian food with a few South Indian items in the buffet at lunch.

I was trying to find a nice place to take my girlfriend for her birthday dinner.  First, we were looking for a Greek place, but didn't find any with decent reviews, so since we have had good luck with Indian food in the past, I figured I'd scour Yelp for suggestions.  I found Tamba to be in the top five on Yelp and found every place in the list to have mixed reviews.  After looking at the web sites of the top five, their menus and plenty of thought, I finally decided on Tamba.  I used opentable.com to make our reservation for 7pm Saturday night.  Since this place is in the Hawaiian Marketplace on the strip, I figured it would be packed.  In fact, one of the reviews said to make sure you get a reservation or your wait could exceed two hours.

When we arrived, the place was pretty empty.  I believe there were only four or five tables taken at that point, so we were greeted by the manager and he wished my girlfriend a happy birthday.  Nice touch.  

I am actually glad the place was empty because the waiter spent a lot of time talking over the menu options and giving us recommendations.  During our conversation with the waiter, we talked about the lamb dishes and he could tell we were hesitant, so he brought over sample for us to try.  It was so good, I chose the Roghan Gosht as my main dish.  My girlfriend chose the Butter Chicken and we started with the Sea Bass appetizer.  On the spice scale, I'd say the lamb was a 5 out of 10 and the butter chicken was a 3.

The wine selection was average, but my girlfriend really enjoyed the fruity martini.

The price was better than I expected for dinner on the strip in Las Vegas.  We both had two drinks, an appetizer, two main dishes, rice, garlic nan and two desert items and got out of there for around $70 and that included the tip.  

Two more signs that Tamba serves good Indian food; by the time we left (8:30ish), the place was packed and there were a lot of actual Indian people dinning there.

We both said that we would go back.

Excellent food. 
Samosa Chaat and Aloo Tikki were some of the best ones I have had so far in America. 
 
The food overall was excellent. 
I'm really glad I decided to come here. First I was skeptical because the place was completely empty. Not a single soul was here. However, a lot of people showed up once we were sitted. 

Highly Recommend to any one.

Almost everyone in Vegas claims to have a special deal for you.  Usually, it's associated with trying to make more from you off something else (once they get you in), or just offering you something at a discount because it was way overpriced to begin with.  Then there are those deals that are so low because it's crappy food (like many of the prime rib specials.) Well, Tamba doesn't fit into any of those categories, but they have a genuine deal: a $12.95 lunch buffet!

And it's not the type of buffet that you're accustomed to running away from.  There are a variety of reasons I stay away from buffets these days, but Indian buffets tend to be an exception. Quality food, and wait for it...fresh food. Shocker!  I had salad with mint chutney, potatoes, rice, marsala, chicken tandoori, and a few other things I can't all remember.  Most of the items contain a description above it, but when I was struggling, one of the employees noticed and gave me a suggestion in a kind matter.  He didn't make me feel dumb at all for not knowing what some things were.

It's a pretty nice restaurant too, quite large and relaxing ambience, really dim.  It's nice to feel relaxed at a buffet, rather then rushing through buffet lines or worrying that the person in front of you is gonna get it before you.  There was none of that here (at least when I went).  I'm surprised it wasn't more crowded on a Sunday afternoon, but I'm not going to complain.  The waiter filled my drinks up frequently and was really polite.

When I want a quality affordable large meal in Vegas, I know where I'll be having lunch.

I am in Las Vegas, NV for a conference. As I had visited Tamba few years back and was impressed at that time, I decided to return today for dinner. But this time the experience was extremely bad. I ordered Vegeterian Thali (Buddha Feast) that came with Dal Makhani, Kofta and Sag Paneer (Spinach and Cheese). As I was eating the people in the next booth tried to order Saag Paneer as an Entree and the waiter told them that it has gone bad so he cannot serve them. I called the  waiter and asked him if Sag Paneer was bad then why did he serve me. He did not have a clear answer and tried to wiggle out of the situation. Then I asked to speak with the manager and brought the same issue to his attention. The Manager (guy with beard) started yelling at me - if it was bad then why did I eat it. Shameful answer (blame the customer). 

I asked him for the check, paid the bill and left. Not going there ever again. I am stressed right now and feeling I will get sick eating bad food. Do not want to get sick while traveling for work.
Order the chicken korma it is to die for. Garlic or plain naan with yellow or basmati rice and you are set!

Given that we were hella drunk and hella hungry, but the food was awesome.  We got 3-4 appetizers and each of them were good, dont remembr what we got though.  For dinner, we got Bhindi, totally awesome, Daal was great, Malai Kofta was good but a very small helping and we got some chicken.  The food was served in exactly 5-7 minutes after we ordered.  The good is it was before time, the bad is, it was all prepared in advance.  The rotis and the paranthas were very good.  We had Kheer and Gajar Ka Halwa.  I highly recommend this place on the strip.  Food was heavy so we walked to our condo at the Signature next to MGM.

Pathetic! Stay away from it. Really atrocious food and even worse service!!! The food was not heated and had a stale taste. Nan's were rock solid.. Chicken, both tandoori and chicken tikka masala prolly the worst I've eaten anywhere!

Yippieeeee this place Rocks.
Love this place on the strip. 
Ambiance,Food,Service, Loved it.
Been to this place on my trip to vegas and never imagined that we will get the top-notch Indian Curry in this Sin City.
Loved their Lunch Buffet $13.95 all you can eat.
You can smell the fresh Vegetables blended with spices the moment you enter their facility.
Buffet was really a surprise package for me and my fellow buddies, enjoyed their Beautiful Buffet spread with Quality Spread (Fresh Fruits, Desserts & Vegetables, good Chicken selection---HEAVEN). 
To all my fooddiees and Curry Lovers must check this place and you will be Glad.
Best wishes to Team Tamba and looking fwd seeing you back on my next visit.

Over all good food right price however pathetic service & attitude of the staff including manager there it took 45 min for a order to come on weekday and tht too it wasn't complete until we completed the entire dinner they didn't bring the raita / chutney we ordered and they tried to sneak in the 2 items in the bill. Won't recommend due to service and attitude issue.

Best Indian food in Las Vegas . Been loyal customer for 5 years. This is my go to spot for halal prepared Indian food. My vegetarian friends love this spot when I bring them also. Feel like negative reviews r their competitors cause who names exact people that get sick from food LOL. Never had bad experience and their garlic nan is always on point
Great Indian food best in vegas ... have been here a number of time and found it amazing always... lunch buffet and budha delight are my personal favorite:)

They do a fine job here.  Most of their vegetarian items beat the hell out of other indian buffet vegetarian items.  Sadly, their meat items do not beat the hell out of other indian buffet meat items.

Good price.  Nice Service.  Nice ambience.  I like it.
One of the best Indian restaurants I ever been to...the smells that hit you, when you first walk in, are amazing!.. staff friendly, try this place, you won't regret it!

We went their for dinner, food was okay. It's expensive for amount of food you get. It's not for original indians who like to eat Indian food with flavor and spice.

Also please be aware that if you are using your ATM card, they will automatically add tips for amount they like so please pay attention. I don't recommend this place for any reason. Service is not that great.

I also read same thing about credit card charges in some other review so please pay with cash if you can.
Great food... great service... we had lunch buffet.. it was great... i will come here for sure whenever i will visit Vegas..

Parking sucks here, so try not to drive.

Once you get over that, then you have to find it.  It's upstairs in the Hawaiian Marketplace.  They have a lunch buffet for $15 which is dang good. usual suspects on this buffet and probably like 15 total choices of things to eat.  I've also eaten here for dinner w/ an Indian client of mine.  And when you eat there for lunch you will see Indians eating there too [great sign in my book!]

I love their Indian techno music.  They have a very nice motif, it's very clean, and the staff is on it.

You can be in and out of here [minus parking] at lunch time in 30 mins if you needed to be.

Not a friendly reception , You have to prepay . When you ask  how many items in the buffet , the answer is "Lots of items" with a eye on the credit card.  You don't even know what you are paying for. The food tastes like its been cooked a long time before.

Not a good selection of the buffet menu.
Bread portions are small. Loved everything else. Friendly staff, good service, and delicious food. Will come back for sure.

I declare this place: The best vegetarian food I've had in Vegas, baby!

Food: They get the spicing right!
Atmosphere: cool-- but more in a San Francisco than Vegas way
Service: attentive and friendly

In Vegas for a convention, and not really that happy with the bazillions of "hotel" restaurant choices (while recognizing that many of them are exceptionally good) and wanting something vegetarian, I looked these guys up and was impressed by their website.

I went alone, as the rest of my compadres were busy at the blackjack tables, or somewhere else doing more "Vegasy" things, and the hostess sat me immediately, gave me a menu, and made sure I received my H20.  

The waiter came, discussed the wine and beer list and suggested a beer-- the name I forget, but it was great.

I ordered the Navrattan Korma, and sort of expected your typical Indian Navrattan Korma, but was pleasantly surprised to receive it with a nice kick-- seriously spiced right!  VERY tasty.   When he first put down the dish I figured I'd eat about half of it, but I polished it off and would have continued eating if there had been more... I've been to Vegas a few times, and have never been all that happy with the food, so it was a real treat to go somewhere this good.

It was truly the best meal I have ever had in Las Vegas.

The food is amazing! Being of Indian heritage and coming from London home to Indian food, I think I can safely say I know what I'm talking about.  My wife and I ordered Chicken Tikka Masala and Chicken Korma respectively, seriously the food was top notch.  The right amount of spices, sauce and heat.  The garlic naan was great too.

The only negative thing about the food is that they don't use Basmati rice... Seriously, an Indian restaurant that doesn't use Basmati rice???? UNHEARD OFF!!! 

However, this is a very minor gripe, the food, decor, ambience more than make up for the choice of rice.  The decor is one that I have never seen in an Indian restaurant, but it works.  The music not being the standard Bollywood or cliche definitely is a welcome choice

Very flavorful and fresh Indian food here!

I was in Vegas with my family from India last summer and we ate here (since almost all of them are vegetarian), and it was delicious! The buffet wasn't very pricey at all and had a ton of choices, both veg and non-veg.  Definitely a yummy place to eat!

The people here are running more a business than a place for some Indian food. I observed the owner & manager to be very business minded & be cared to the customers with such perspective. 
Thats different story, who cares if the food end up delicious, which isn't the case. Less than average taste, not all the items in Menu are available. The only advantage its at the Strip. Else I liked the food http://www.everestcuisine.net/, far better than in Tamba during my 3 day visit to Vegas.

Dinner prices are very reasonable.  It's surprising how busy it can be considering the location way back in a plaza with nothing else there.  They offer a multisampler dinner which gives you small portions of 4 or 5 things.  I got the buddah's delight which included a few vegetarian dishes and also included rice and naan for $21 but I didn't like everything that was offered.  I would rather just have one large portion of a dish I really liked for $13 instead.  The saag paneer was incredible.  It's amazing how every restaurant does it differently.  This was more pureed than others.  

I looked at their selection for the lunch buffet and it still looks great.  Look forward to checking it out again.
I love this place! EVERY dish we had was amazing and the staff was so friendly. Even on a Friday night our food came out in a timely manner and looked great.

This place is an exotic gem hidden inside the crappiness that is the Hawaiian Marketplace. Walking through this rundown strip mall and into a mysteriously empty building and up the escalator, I did not expect to find a beautiful atmosphere of Indian decor. I really regret ordering take out instead of staying to dine in but my friends and I all picked up food from various places and we wanted to eat together.

I was immediately greeted by a gentleman who gave me helpful suggestions on all of their vegan-friendly items. This made ordering very easy for me. While there were several options, I decided on the following:

Kali Dal (slow cooked Black Lentils and spices) http://su.pr/7Wv21z
Veggie Samosas (about 5 or 6 pieces) http://su.pr/2wAdc9
Tandoori Roti - whole wheat flat bread
Basmati Rice

One sad thing about take out is that the presentation is not as elegant. However, it smelled good, it tasted good, and I was happy. My friends were definitely peering over at my food. I even gave away one of my tasty Veggie Samosas. For the $33 that I paid, I had a full vegan meal plus enough leftovers for a second meal which tasted just as good two evenings later.

Great deal for the price. The location of the restaurant is strange. Hidden inside of the Hawaiian Marketplace.
Inside atmosphere is very nice.
Had the lunch buffet which was very good- spicy food which we loved.
Good bet if you want to get away from the strip for awhile.
Hey, this is really good food! We ordered Chana masala, navratan korma, malai kofta, naan, vegetable samosas, rice, and raita--all prepared exquisitely.
Awesome food! Had malai kofta, chicken curry and veg biryani. All of them were great. We loved the food..

We had a really lovely experience!  The ambiance is tasteful, and our service was very friendly and helpful.  He politely explained the items on the menu since we proved to be Indian food dummies.  

Tamba does not open until 6:00.  Parking can be a bit confusing.  There is a lot behind Mcdoanld's...there is a booth with a parking attendant...says $5.  We told them we had a dinner reservation at Tamba and he let us right in.  No $5 necessary.

We tried the cheese appetizer served with spicy mint sauce, tamarind sauce and crackers.  It was really good!  We had lamb korma, chicken tikka masala, eggplant, 2 types of naan, and basmati rice.  The sauces on the chicken and lamb were excellent but the meat was dry in both.  The eggplant was out of this world.  Everything had great flavor.  

I would definitely go back and I'm recommending it to all.  

We spent $100 for 4 with all the aforementioned and 2 large beers.
Slightly overpriced but good. Service was not that great. Hidden on the strip, how can they afford rent?  i wonder!

This place is little gem in vegas

It is hidden inside mall but the ambience is calming.

The food is top notch. My favorite includes dosa sambar along with upma.

I went here 4-5 times and not even once i found any food cold or bad . 

Lastly don't miss the tea . It is really nice.

Enjoy this awesome indian place in vegas !!!

Good tasty food. Very pricy as expected in Vegas. Still they over charged me on my credit card. I would suggest you to pay by cash like in any tourist place. I went for dinner Buffett. Deserts are ordinary.

I came here with my coworkers after a long boring sunday at work. Eating here was definitely the highlight of my day. We ordered:

-Chicken Tikka: delicious cubes of flavorful chicken served with sides of mint as well as tamarind sauces. 
-Tandoori Chicken: delicious preperation, i only wish the cuts of chicken were meatier. 
-Chicken Tikka Masala: my favorite dish. Full of flavor and soft tender chicken pieces. The sauce base is perfect for dipping your naan into. 
-Chicken Vindaloo: the spice level was perfect. it was spicy enough for those who are adventurous, but it wasn't so spicy that is took away from the wonderful flavor. 
-Yellow fried rice: great flavor, perfect accompaniment to the tandoori chicken. 
-Naan: plain butter and garlic : both were excellent. flaky with a soft fluffy center. 
-Drinks: Bombay 7, Sapporo beer, Strawberry daiquiri  

The service was fantastic both from the waiter and the bussers. The ambiance was excellent and the decor and dishes they used to serve the food were very modern. I would not hesitate to take a date here.

This review is solely for the lunch buffet:

Tamba offers perhaps the best Indian lunch buffet in town.  Unlike most Indian restaurants in Vegas, the cooks at Tamba don't focus on a bland tourist palate.  And as a result, they don't produce spice-less offerings.

What the buffet does offer is an amazing array of vegetarian options--tasty, spicy and delicious options--chana masala (chick pea masala), palak paneer and various other vegetable-based deliciousness.  But the buffet isn't solely for the vegetable lover.  The Tamba buffet also carries several chicken dishes in well-crafted sauces.  If you've eaten at a few Vegas Indian buffets, you'll know that tasty and spicy foods are rare.  So if you're near the south side of the strip for lunch, you can't do much better.

As for the dinner or regular dishes (not in buffet form), I haven't tried them, but several India-born friends have told me that Tamba is the best Indian restaurant in town.

Indian food on the strip!!! Yaya!! 
It was like visiting lil India on the strip. 
We reached here when it was 10:45PM, yes they were even letting in people when it was 11PM. 
The food was just ok, not spicy to my indian taste buds. But yes you can ask them to make it spicy.

Stopped in for a late dinner and we were greeted very friendly and had the best Indian food!  Kumar,
our friendly server, kept our glasses full and made sure we were very happy. We had chicken tikka masala - (nicely spicy!) and chicken korma, creamy and delicious!! I highly recommend this restaurant while you are here in Vegas.  Thanks Kumar!!
Amazing food! Great atmosphere! Don't let the location discourage you! Great service on too of it!

I am giving 3 star just because i liked the "classic chicken curry" else i was so furious about the service.
I went on a Friday night and totally understand the footfall volume and that can cause delays in service. However, i ordered a "tikki-chole" as appetizer and that took more than 30 mins which is really not acceptable and beside that it wasn't good in taste.

But chicken curry taste was good and they also give chopped onion with lemon and green chili just like India ;-).

The wait-staff really need to work on the service and when a customer is asking for something they should return and should not take any request casually.
Requested pander tikki masala per other yelp user. Excellent dish.  Solid service. Only complaint is they charge for rice.  I hate that.

This is the absolute WORST restaurant I have ever been to. The service is the Worst. The staff is very rude. I was there for dinner the day before Thanksgiving with my family and had a very bad experience. 

Please avoid and try one of the other Indian restaurants on the strip.

My boyfriend and I were starving and didn't want to walk very far from MGM for dinner. We found this place on yelp and were skeptical about the place since the location was quite hidden and not many people were dining in. 

Anyway, we were there last night. It was our first time to have Indian cuisine, so we absolutely didn't know what to order. Our server was very welcoming, friendly, and very informative. He made very good recommendations for our entrees which was called Karahi Chicken. It was AWESOME! It had the right amount of spice and had such a great thick blend of curry with onions tomatoes, peppers, and cilantro. Served with garlic flavored Nan. I ordered the Ashoka's Feast which consisted a taste of India's most popular dishes and that was amazing.

So to sum it up. Great service from our waiter. Great food because my boyfriend was very happy at the end of dinner, even though he was feeling down when he lost $150 gambling. Lol.

Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: no wait but I think I got lucky. It's a small place and they take walk ins only. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: normal service. Clean. Cozy little place. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

2/3 Stars: food was really good. 

_____

Overall Experience

4/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words

Cozy.

If u have no value for ur money and also if u like eating tasteless food ...i suggest u going there.......we went there for eating authentic indian food and ate the worst indian food.......i dont know how they got so many good reviews.

we ordered fish curry, prawns, briyani and fried rice.............the fish curry and prawns had the same masala they just put some prawns and fish in the curries......also the no of prawns was v less(hardly 4-5 nos) .briyani and fried rice tasted the same except it looked bit different....

i had seen photo of many bollywood (indian stars) coming to  this place.....i am sure they will never come again if they had the chance to taste their plain food.

CONCLUSION- WORST FOOD & PRICEY (100 dollar for 2)

A little off the strip in a deserted mall. Really good Indian food. Just an excellent choice to take break from all those Burgers and Burgrs and Best Burgers Ever on the strip. Also easy on your wallet! Highly recommend it.

Legit spot for hangover brunch. If you can wake up early enough for it. I'm very critical of Indian restaurants but this lunch buffet hits the spot like a triple chilled, quintuple distilled, boutique vodka. Service is hit or miss but the food makes up for it. If you're jonesing for different edible fare in Vegas in between the $80 buffets and the Subway in that crappy casino on the Strip, this is a solid choice to soak up your alcohol indiscretions. If you shoot fire out of your bunghole the next day, it might be Tamba. Then again, it might be the result of table service at Marquee. Who knows?
We enjoyed the buffet and it was reasonably price of $12.95. I would recommend visiting here.

This place is awesome!! We had dinner here last night and we were pleasantly surprised. Not only was the food delicious, but the portion size was perfect. The price was great and we left very satisfied. This is probably our top favorite Indian restaurant so far.

I went there on a long weekend while my stay in Vegas. We could not order ala-carte because  only evening buffet was available due to the rush, that's what they told us. There were many obcains both for veg and non-veg. The only negative point I can say is that the biriyani rice wasn't proper basmati rice and the taste should  have been better but all other food were really nice.
I recommend this restro if you want to taste Indian food in Las Vegas.

I went to Tamba for the Christmas buffet. I ordered with my boyfriend 2 mango lassi (my ultimate favorite drink), and let's say should I have ordered water, I would have been better off! The lassi was very sugary and watery, really really bad.

Regarding the food, the buffet offered a lot of vegetarian options so I went for the butter chicken and it was more of a soup than a rich curry... Plus omg the spiciness!

All and all I was highly dissatisfied, especially as it was Christmas and I love indian food. Would recommend you to go elsewhere.

Pathetic service.. Ordered one chicken biryani.. They took more than hour to deliver biryani and no response from the staff.. wasted my time only because my kid loves biryani and walkable from strip..

I was impressed by the excellent food and good service. You can tell that the food here is actually cooked by Indians. They vary the degree of spicyness, just tell them what you like. I had the Aloo Gobi, which is vegan ny the way. My favorite Indian dish, a potato-cauliflower curry. The portions are pretty big, I took half of it home.
The food is expensive, service and taste was not much to write about.  Overall experience below average.

I rarely write negative reviews. But, experience at Tamba has been so different that I had to.
6 of us went for lunch buffet on the 30th December 2015 afternoon. We were happy to find an Indian place on the strip! The ambience was good, location was great and the food tasted ok as well! Upma was very tasty. Idly was very dry - probably because we went around 2:00 pm which was too late for the food to be fresh.

My main complaint is,the minute we completed our lunch all of us felt extremely drowsy and sleepy. All of us were not up until late evening. We were surprised that all 6 of us felt the same way! Neither we were sleep deprived nor extremely tired to doze off after lunch.

On sharing this with our friends, we came to know that 12 of our friends had lunch buffet in Tamba sometime in September 2015. Most of them had an upset stomach. 

All other restaurants had a long wait time because of which we chose to go to an Indian place. Had we chosen a different place, we might explored the strip that afternoon instead of warming our beds. 

Hope this is not happening to anyone else!

No taste what so ever in any of our food. We ordered 3 different kinds of "shaak" n all of them tasteless. Even the customer service was bad. We had to ask for water 2 or 3 time. No one even come to ask how was the food.  Very disappointed.

Tamba Buffet!

Newly renovated Indian Restaurant. Been there before. Food has improved. Variety as well. Lot to choose from. Great ambiance. Nice seating arrangements.
Would definitely recommend it if you want to try some Indian food on the strip. 
Walking distance from Planet Hollywood.

Tamba is a place to Re-mamba!
Cheers!

3.5 stars!!

A good place to have a quick bite on the strip.
The portion size is not that big for the price. But this is Vegas!!
Came here for dinner, and the food quality was good. Not too spicy, bit just enough.

The food was excellent, this place in on the top 3 Indian Food restaurants we have dined at.  I would highly recommend. Not the easiest place to find being on the back upper floor of a shopping plaza but it is worth finding.

Had a group of 4, 2 of wich were vegetarian and 1 was Indian.  So we had a variety mix of things from the menu and everything was up to par.  All people in the group were happy with the food.  Things were made well and tasty.  Service was decent.  The wobbly table was annoying.

Only minor thing was the heat level. We all asked for HOT, the server said Indian hot?  We all said YES... and it was unanimous that it came more a medium.  That didnt ruin anything.  Just a preference.

There was a buffet for a "private" party that all filed in while we were eating. So towards the end of our meal it was quite busy.

This is a place I would go again. The prices were reasonable, the food was really good, portioned well, good variety and there were no major issues during our visit.  We all found it enjoyable.
Delicious food, and incredible service! We had a great time! Our server Kumar is wonderful!

Things have changed tremendously at Tamba from my earlier visit, which was about 2 years back. Unfortunately, things have taken a downturn.

Parking is a pain. If you can walk or take a taxi, do that instead. 

First thing that throws us off is the prepay for lunch buffet. I mean, this is the only restaurant I know where you have to prepay for the buffet. Yes, the spread of the dishes is good; that is where we were deceived :(

The veggie dishes were bland and lacked the flavor and punch of the Indian spices! The 'Malai Kofta' was too salty. The 'saag paneer' lacked paneer and was only a mishmash of spinach; the chole was OK and lacked the punch as well. The Idlis: like rubber! Upma was OK. 

From the desserts, the Gulab Jamun was OK and the Custard was alright too. But then, he placed small containers to fill them up. We filled our stomachs with mostly the desserts(not a healthy way, I know) and for a high-price of almost $13 per person. 

There are better Indian restaurants, I would recommend. Go to Gandhi's or India Place instead and be treated to some flavorful food and better service.

And waiters in Tamba: Grow up and dont play 'Catch ball' when you have customers...and by 'Ball' I mean...you know what?

And to end this, I AM NOT GOING THERE AGAIN!

Even buffet was pretty darn good for 19 dollars .  When they have menu service, that kicks butt.
A good deal on the strip of excess.
Superb food! Great hospitality and wonderfully welcoming hosts. All the food was brilliantly prepared and we were served with a smile!
Good food.. Came here for lunch buffet with parents. They loved the food and so did we.

GO for the FOOD, not the ambiance.

We were in Vegas for my sister's wedding (indian), my extended family pretty much ate here everynight except one (the reception). 

The buffet is great for vegetarians, they keep it fresh and warm. the food is excellent and lots of choices. The meat stuff was good too, but I was too fully from everything else.

The service was fair, our nephew has some food allergies and they were not overly accomadating in tyring to prepare something outside the buffet. 

There seems to be a caravan of indian tourist buses that roll thru the area in the evenings, so be prepared for it to be busy.

Decided to go here for lunch with my brother because we were craving for some Indian food and we were essentially stuck on the Strip so this was the perfect place to go to!
 
This place is a bit different since you have to pay upfront before going into the buffet. It is also easy to miss because it is located in the Hawaiian Marketplace Plaza. You have to go into the main building next to the Chili's and just ignore the rundown shops on the first floor as you ascend to the second level where this restaurant is located.  

They have a good selection of food like naan, butter chicken, basmati rice, tandoori chicken, and some other items. The naan is in the buffet so you can grab as much as you want when you want it! The only downer is that it is plain naan instead of garlic, but it still tastes fine since you can just eat it with the curry for flavor. 

I'd recommend checking this place out if you like Indian food and want a change of pace when it comes to eating on the strip. The lunch price with the Yelp discount was about $14-15/ person which isn't too bad considering the food and location. Also, I saw a bunch of Indian people when we walked in so that must mean this place is good! The staff is also very attentive as they refill your drink and take away your plates in a timely manner.
Ambience is good and staff is vrry freindly but the food was not at all good. I wud say only buffets are good here

Tamba is an authentic Indian restaurant - hidden in a small plaza across from the Monte Carlo Casino.

Clean, Dimly lit, smaller tables and with Indian decor throughout - this place had a casual yet intimate atmosphere.  The service was fast and friendly - the staff seemed to genuinely appreciate our business.

We ordered authentic Indian dishes - Prawn Mackne, Classic Chicken curry & .  The dishes were generously proportioned, full of spices and flavor.  Combined with the Yelp discount - 2 dinner entrees, 3 drinks & an appetizer came out to a rather modest price of $65.00

Tamba may not be on anyone's 5 star list of restaurants - but we enjoyed an unexpected yet exceptional dining experience.
Only option for lunch is the $14 buffet and the selection is limited. Food was ok, I have had better.  The area smelled real bad too.

This place is amazing. Food is great and good value too. If you are looking for comforting food with cozy setting. Its far from busy street. Navratan korma was great and Nan was much better than other places.

A little secret hidden in the Hawaiian marketplace, Tamba was a surprising find and the quality was outstanding.

I was with a party of 5 and we all got something different and spent the evening swapping tastes of each others dishes. I myself had "Palak Paneer" and "Yellow Rice". The paneer was excellent and generous portions of tofu. The rice was nearly perfect but just a tad undercooked/dry but worked well as a mix with the paneer wrapped up in fresh nan.

The dishes and the restaurant are well presented with authentic palettes and decor. The music was subtle an unobtrusive and the waiter was superb.

While this restaurant is in Vegas, the prices were a little high than I'd normally expect but are a pretty good deal considering the location. Good deals can be had if you check the normal coupon books. There are specific ones for Tamba that could have saved us a bit.

With all that said, while the food was excellent, the staff was superb, and the atmosphere was inviting, the restrooms were atrocious. I was pretty shocked considering the dining experience to find the bathrooms somewhat trashed and unkept which worried me a little.

Overall I still give Tamba 4/5, but please folks, take care of those frightening bathrooms and you'd easily be a 5.
Went there for a dinner buffet with friends and it was delicious. Variety of Indian food and the dessert is outstanding (must try the mango custard).

Ok so I havn't yelped in a while, but this place is just that good and should be way more busy for how good the food is. Do people who go to vegas not like indian food? Seriously, if you get tired if crappy overpriced food on the strip try here.  I have eaten at the best inian places in sf(amber, indian oven, etc) and tamba is right up there with them - in Vegas!  My goodness, what a pleasant surprise. I just pounded the butter chicken, the chicken was like tender like duck confit and the sauce was perfect flavor and not too creamy. The rice is fluffy and my nan was perfect for dipping. I am stuffed, will be back for more!

If you love Butter Chicken, Mango Lassi, and Rice Pudding, this right here is the place to be. 

Hidden off to the side of the strip, this little gem is a quiet place with excellent service. The Samosas were tasty, and the overall portion size was very good. By the time we made it to dessert, I had to at least try the Rice Pudding. And it was fabulous. 

Not to mention I was the only white person among tons of Indians, so you know it's legit. 


*The word Indian in reference to people from India, not the other word that magically angers social justice warriors*

Found this gem of an Indian restaurant through Yelp while on business in Vegas. This place serves FANTASTIC food and appears to be a locals hangout, not a tourist trap. 

I seriously doubt there is better Indian food in Vegas.
I've been in this place for a couple times already ,so I decided to bring my mom for a dinner. She loves it ,so I'm . It's just amazing !! Nice warm atmosphere and delicious food. Won't regret

We had such a delicious dinner experience that we came back for lunch. Tamba is located a few steps off the strip and up one flight of stairs. It looked empty or closed but once we walked in we were pleasantly surprised to see a very nice restaurant full of customers. We love Indian food and this restaurant is clean, has nice service,  great food and reasonable prices--especially for Las Vegas.   We will be back for sure.

I use to go at this restaurant. But on my last visti, I saw customer bring their used plate or bowl to get food and the employees never say any thing to customers that this is not right. Spechala got tuch their dirty plats or bowl and same Spechala every one elsa use it, Not right. I will never go here again. Taste of food is not same any more.

A tiny Indian Resturant tucked away on the strip. Getting parking sucks if you are trying to drive there, I had to park in public park for $5. This place is in a hole twin the wall. It's hidden inside a tiny mall that's mostly vacant; a bit eerie at night. 

The service here is actually pretty good in comparison to other Indian restaurants around town but for a place on the strip it's actually average at best. I used the yelp check to get the 10% off. The server knew immediately when I raised my phone so it's nice the staff is competent and very friendly. 

The quality of food in comparison to other Indian places around town is a bit sub standard. Especially with respect towards price. They have a nice variety from North to South Indian dishes. Your standard tikka masala meal is there as well as a butter chicken dish aka chicken makkni. 

The naan is very good especially when fresh from the plain to the garlic you can't really go wrong.

This is a three star review because of poor parking accessibility and quality of food. If the staff wasn't so great this would have been a 1 star. All in all average food with above average staff is a 3 star.

Me and my husband came twice to this restaurant and we pretty much ate their entire menu! This place is lovely, the food is amazing, the service was friendly and generous, I felt I was in India again with the good vibes! I truly recommend you to visit and to come hungry for spicy dishes and sweet desert! I recommend the palak panir dish and the yellow dal with yellow rise and Roti.
Best buffet i have had in US and have has it in all places NY, SFO , Chicago etc but this was the best so far..... Deasset options can be bit better though
Delicious Indian food with great service and good ambiance. On the strip too!! Samosa chaat was good. We also had aloo gobi and paneer tikka masala. Will visit again next time we're in Vegas

Best Indian buffet I've had in my life and I'm not exaggerating.  The dishes that should be spicy were actually spicey.  Very affordable and although the building looks a little rundown on the outside, it's nice and clean on the inside.  The hostess was friendly, too.  Only thing that could've been better was the naan.  It wasn't crispy at all, but what do you expect unless it's made to order?

I love the lunch buffet at this place!  The food is great! The chicken makhani is just awesome. Everytime I eat here, I get up to get food from the buffet around 3 times or so. 

The place looks nice also. Can't wait to go back next time I'm in Vegas!

Excellent food here, had lamb chops and butter chicken, very friendly waiters.  The place is very clean you get a whole lot to eat, at a good price. This is my second time eating here and I will most definitely be back when I'm in Vegas.  Our waiter was Kumar and he was great.

We found this place one day when we were walking along the strip and I was not feeling well.  I have hypoglycemia and had not eaten in several hours.  We had been wondering around the Hawian Marketplace and I was feeling so bad I was not sure what I was doing.  We went in the building which sadly is deserted on the first floor and one of the employees directed us upstairs.  He could see I was ill and got the manager who immediately got us a table.  Once I had been seated and started getting back to normal we ordered.  I had the butter chicken which was amazing and my BF had the curried Goat.  Our waiter was shocked he asked for the goat and had to make sure they still had some but came back smiling and letting us know it was still available.  He said it was fantastic.  Our waiter was attentive and kept a positive attitude even though and indian couple behind us ordered several things and kept sending them back unhappy he never lost patience with anyone.   It was a great meal and we would go back.  At the time one of the half price outlets had coupons to reduce the price.  We also ate here on Christmas day for the lunch buffet and while it was good none of the entrees were marked and even a few indian customers questioned what the dishes were.  I was not nearly as impressed with the buffet.
Went herewith my friends and had the lunch buffet. Very limited choices. Only chicken and vegetarian. Naan was crispy...not much more to say.
From a foodie - Wonderful food and lovely ambiance. Decor is pleasing to the eye and unlike most Indian restaurants - that's a plus

The best Indian food I've tried so far.  And I've tried a lot, in many different places all over the World.  They use a tandoor oven, so you can find some healthy dishes that taste really great.  Their vegetable dishes are incredible as well!  I love their buffet too, because you can try all the different dishes and figure out what it is that you like.  Everything is labeled so you know what you are getting.  The atmosphere is nice, and the service is great.  Oh, their food is so good...I think I will go there now!

For Vegas this is definitely awesome! I went here for Dinner and was very pleasantly surprised with the dishes. I have eaten a lot of really good Indian food and this wasn't going down as the best, but come on, it's Vegas. If this was a restaurant in NYC it would get about 3 stars, but in Vegas it gets 4. The naan was ok, same goes for the raita. The dishes though were very tasty and spicy. The location is really odd, it's in the back of a crappy food court, but it is really nice inside. The prices were awesome for Vegas, and I'll definitely frequent it when I visit.

Pros:
1) Good food. 
2) Great Naan. 
3) Not too spicy or oily. 
4) Great location. 

Con
1) Bathroom is small, dark and dirty. Not enough lighting and paper rolls lying all over the floor. 
2) A $18 buffet should have more variety.

I was a bit hesitant from the looks outside and that there was not a lot of patrons inside so I passed, but came back the night after. Come to find out, the patrons are mostly Indian (good sign), the food was delicious, I had the fish masala (spicy) with rice, onion naan, plus tamarind/mint chutney, everything was great, service was more 'human' than other restaurants on the strip, prices were not bad.

This is a hidden gem on the Las Vegas strip. It's not in a casino. You can't see it from the strip. It's tucked away behind the Hawaiian Marketplace. And it is totally worth the journey to get there. 

I think one way to judge quality and authenticity of a restaurant is by the clientele. There were many people of Indian descent here, and that made us even more excited for our feast!

And what a feast it was!  I had Ashoka's feast which included and appetizer and then four small dishes and rice. It also included naan... And this was the first time I had ever been to an Indian restaurant where i did not have to order more naan. They served plenty. 

The lamb roganjosh was prepared with a perfect blend of spices. The chicken masala also prepared just to taste. Everything was very flavorful and though try described it as spicey, nothing was too spicey.  This meal also included a donuthole dessert with a sweet caramel sauce. 

They were able to accommodate our large party (15) on relatively short notice for a Saturday night. 

If you're in the mood for Indian food while on the strip, check out Tamba!

The staff was extraordinarily attentive and professional.

Good Indian is very hard to come by in Phoenix, so I was looking forward to Tamba. The meal and company were both enjoyable. Prices were very reasonable. The meal came out to $55 with wine!

Wine: Bonny Doon Riesling. Something about a sweet white wine pairs nicely with spicy, rich Indian food. This retails for $11 and paid $26 at the restaurant. Not too bad of a mark-up I guess. 

Entrees: Tandoori chicken--yum yum. Very generous portion. 
Prawn Makhni--rich buttery cream sauce. On the spicy side. 
Chicken Tikka Masala -- another rich flavorful curry. 
3 dishes with rice and garlic nan--the 3 of us were completely stuffed.

Would I go back? Yes.

On the Strip, this place is a gift from Guru Nanak. 

If picked up and dropped anywhere else in the world? It's pretty good.

North Indian type food here is nothing inspiring, but satisfying. We had the buffet and my vegetarian man was happy. 

I was happy with the food--decent naan, mint chutney, tandoori chicken -- the usual stuff I get. The best part was being off the Strip and away from the "Hey Bro!" douchebags. It was clean and quiet. This is hard to find on the Strip and a I relished the calm.
Too pricey. Ambience is great. Food is just fine. 2 stars down for the price and taste.

Great food!!
Really like the ambience and food.
Sambar was excellent.
Must try indian food if you are on strip!!

Every time I've been to Vegas I have been wanting to try out this restaurant. So this past weekend when I was in Vegas I dragged my partner there. He had the tikka masala and I had the chicken tandoori, sharing  basmati rice and naan bread. My meal was utter perfection. The service was adequate, we were not in any sort of hurry. My only complaint is that I wished the buffet option was available for dinner. I will definitely go there the next time I am in Vegas.

I think where the rating is right now at 3 1/2 is probably right. I also agree with a lot of other yelpers about getting the best indian buffet for your money. First, I dont expect to be amazed by a buffet, and second, i definitely dont expect to be amazed by a buffet that is so cheap (compared to other buffets on the strip). You get a good variety of indian food (mostly vegetarian) and its around $13. What is the funniest thing about this place is where it is located. It is inside a, what seems to be an abandoned food court type building, and is the only that has been running ever since I first came here 4 years ago. Seriously, I have never seen any other store in this food court open. 
I think if you dont mind eating a little unhealthy indian food that tastes decent you should check this place out. I have had their fresh food here once, and honestly this is one place where their fresh food tastes slightly better than their buffet. Usually, the restaurant's fresh food tastes way better than their buffet, but I guess their food quality doesnt change much between ordering off the menu or the buffet.

I have eaten at a number of Indian restaurants over the years and so glad to have found this one. Had a wonderful dinner and superb service. The waiter was very professional with great suggestions when asked. I had the fiery spicy lamb dish that was excellent. Nice decor and atmosphere. Reasonably priced, wonderful tastes, and a great value. If you enjoy authentic Indian food you must make take the time to indulge yourself. Thank you TAMBA for keeping it real!

Oh Yelpers, how you have failed me!  

My boyfriend and I found Tamba's advertisement in one of Vegas's books during our visit, and decided to go here for dinner after reading the "good reviews" and ratings on yelp.  After finally having eaten there,  I would give this place HALF a star if I could, for its bad food and terrible service!
